errors.delete: The vault could not be deleted at this time.

placeholder_for_vaults.konnect: Filter by exact prefix or ID

empty_state.title: Configure a New Vault
empty_state.description: Improve the security of your Kong Gateway deployment with centralized secrets.

empty_state_v2.title: Configure your first vault
empty_state_v2.group: Vaults created in gateways within this group will automatically appear here.
empty_state_v2.description: Vaults securely and centrally store sensitive information, such as credentials, tokens, and keys, to simplify secrets management.

empty_state.title: No Secrets Stored
empty_state.description: Improve the security of your Kong Gateway deployment with centralized secrets.

info.title: Secret
info.description: Enter the secret key and secret value to be stored in Konnect vault

value.label: Value
value.placeholder: Enter value here, can be simple values or multi-line

form.hint: Once saved, the secret value will not be visible

general.title: General Information
general.description: General information helps identify and manage this Vault instance.

config.title: Vault Configuration
config.description: Select a type of Vault and configure properties specific to each type of Vault.

prefix.label: Prefix
prefix.placeholder: Enter a unique prefix for this vault
prefix.tooltip: The reference prefix. You need this prefix to access secrets stored in this vault. For example, {vault://<your-prefix>/<some-secret>}.

description.label: Description
description.placeholder: Enter some description for this vault

tags.label: Tags
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma

konnect.label: Konnect
konnect.description: Access secrets stored directly in Konnect's unified platform to easily reference in Kong Gateway configuration.

env.label: Environment Variables
env.description: Access secrets stored via variables to be made available in Kong Gateway at runtime.

prefix.label: Environment Variable Prefix
prefix.placeholder: Enter your environment variable vault prefix
prefix.tooltip: Data plane will access all the environment variables starting with this prefix.

aws.label: AWS Secrets Manager
aws.description: Access secrets stored in AWS Secrets Manager for Kong Gateway configuration.

region.label: Region
region.tooltip: The AWS region your vault is located in

endpoint_url.label: Endpoint URL
endpoint_url.tooltip: The AWS SecretsManager service endpoint url. If not specified, the value used by vault will be the official AWS SecretsManager service url which is `https://secretsmanager.<region>.amazonaws.com`. You can specify a complete URL(including the "http/https" scheme) to override the endpoint that vault will connect to.

assume_role_arn.label: Assume Role ARN
assume_role_arn.tooltip: The target AWS IAM role ARN that will be assumed. Typically this is used for operating between multiple roles or cross-accounts. If you are not using assume role you should not specify this value.

role_session_name.label: Role Session Name
role_session_name.tooltip: The role session name used for role assuming.

sts_endpoint_url.label: STS Endpoint URL
sts_endpoint_url.tooltip: The custom STS endpoint URL used for role assuming in AWS Vault. Note that this value will override the default STS endpoint URL(which should be `https: //sts.amazonaws.com`, or `https: //sts.<region>.amazonaws.com` if you have `AWS_STS_REGIONAL_ENDPOINTS` set to `regional`). If you are not using private VPC endpoint for STS service, you should not specify this value.

gcp.label: Google Secret Manager
gcp.description: Access secrets stored in Google Secret Manager for Kong Gateway configuration.

project_id.label: Project ID
project_id.placeholder: Enter your Google Cloud Project ID

tooltip.text: Visit your Google API Console and select {italic-text} in the projects list to see your project ID

hcv.label: HashiCorp Vault
hcv.description: Access secrets stored in HashiCorp Vault for Kong Gateway configuration.

jwt_role.label: JWT Role
jwt_role.tooltip: The configured role name in HashiCorp Vault for JWT auth. When creating the role in HashiCorp Vault, make sure that the `role_type` is `jwt` and the `token_policies` have permissions to read the secrets.

azure.label: Azure Vault
azure.description: Access secrets stored in Azure Key Vault for Kong Gateway configuration.

conjur.label: CyberArk Secrets Manager
conjur.description: Access secrets stored in CyberArk Secrets Manager for Kong Gateway configuration.

endpoint_url.label: Server
endpoint_url.tooltip: The CyberArk Secrets Manager backend url. Accepts http or https.

login.label: Workload Identity
login.tooltip: Identity of the workload or host authenticating to CyberArk Secrets Manager. In this case Kong is the workload/host.

api_key.label: API Key
api_key.tooltip: The API key issued to the workload.

account.label: Account
account.tooltip: The CyberArk Secrets Manager account for which the token will be issued. This is the identifier provided during CyberArk Secrets Manager configuration.

advancedFields.title: View Advanced Fields
advancedFields.ttlTooltip: Time-to-live (in seconds) of a secret from the vault when it's cached. The special value of 0 means "no rotation" and it's the default. When using non-zero values, it is recommended that they're at least 1 minute.
advancedFields.negTtlTooltip: Time-to-live (in seconds) of a vault miss (no secret). Negatively cached secrets will remain valid until neg_ttl is reached, after which Kong will attempt to refresh the secret again. The default value for neg_ttl is 0, meaning no negative caching occurs.
advancedFields.resurrectTtlTooltip: Time (in seconds) for how long secrets will remain in use after they are expired (config.ttl is over). This is useful when a vault becomes unreachable, or when a secret is deleted from the Vault and isn't replaced immediately. On both cases, the Gateway will keep trying to refresh the secret for resurrect_ttl seconds. After that, it will stop trying to refresh. We recommend assigning a sufficiently high value to this configuration option to ensure a seamless transition in case there are unexpected issues with the Vault. The default value for resurrect_ttl is 1e8 seconds, which is about 3 years.

base64_decode.label: Base64 Decode
base64_decode.tooltip: Decode all secrets in this vault as base64, useful for binary data. If some of the secrets are not base64 encoded, an error will occur when using them. It's recommended to create a separate vault for base64 secrets.

form.unavailable: This vault provider is available on Enterprise.

secret_id.label: Secret ID
secret_id.select_placeholder: Select or enter a complete secret ID

optional_secret_key.label: Secret Key
optional_secret_key.placeholder: Enter the key or key path to access a nested secret value

fetch_error.vaults_and_secrets: Could not fetch available vaults and secrets
